title: Can Distributism Answer Game B's Questions? pt 10 Principles in Context: Let's Revillage Our Economy
description:
Concluding my series on distributism with a consideration of how principles of Catholic Social Teaching regarding the economy might be applied. Distributists favor the small and local. I make the case that suburban life is full of untapped productive capacity that Permaculture design can unleash and community rights can secure.

Community Rights Movement: https://celdf.org/community-rights/
What is Community Rights? by Paul Cienfuegos https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tQ9J2JlFysk
Interview with Paul Cienfuegos 2012 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V_QRGpBkRvw
A Growing Concern: Paul Cienfuegos 2016 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tpYgOcG7htw

David Holmgren Retrofitting The Suburbs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2cjhQWdbqE4&list=PLVfn3syzjy97kNpxZr5LApvuE4A4tE1Ln 

Jordan Hall The Civium Project: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL4HY2aw0rBsS9hs9hw5fZi8jzLSEFW5fj

Scriptural texts referenced in this video:
Then he said to them, "Watch out! Be on your guard against all kinds of greed; life does not consist in an abundance of possessions." Luke 12:15 (NIV)

“Two things I ask of you, LORD; do not refuse me before I die: Keep falsehood and lies far from me; give me neither poverty nor riches, but give me only my daily bread. Otherwise, I may have too much and disown you and say, ‘Who is the LORD?’ Or I may become poor and steal, and so dishonor the name of my God. Proverbs 30:7-9  (NIV)

How to pronounce my last name: The "c" is silent just to confuse people.
Bringing Joseph Ratzinger (Benedict XVI) into the converZation in Paul VanderKlay's little corner of the internet.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BqinRbjqy2c
